did.abstract: Ann Arbor, Michigan photographer. Photonegatives of Ann Arbor area businesses, service and fraternal organizations, school and other youth groups.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The negatives were donated by James and Janice Leach (donor no. 9709) in March 2006.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright has been transferred to the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, James Leach Photonegatives, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: James Leach worked as a professional photographer in Ann Arbor throughout the 1930s, 40s and 50s. Over the course of this career, he saved a number of negatives of Southeastern Michigan local businesses, organizations, and prominent individuals. While the bulk of Leach's work was made up of private studio portraiture, a number of the photos document the region's commercial architecture, advertisements, and social culture of the period.

scopecontent.p: The James Leach photographic collection consists entirely of celluloid negatives in three boxes. The first two boxes are composed of 4X5" prints, while the third is an oversize box containing the 5X7" negatives as noted in the contents list. The bulk of these materials are images depicting Ann Arbor business and educational institutions as well as athletic and community organizations. There is also a select number of Detroit-area photographs, as labeled. These materials are divided into four main series: Business and Commerce, Youth Activities and Educational Facilities, Community Organizations, Groups and Institutions, and Miscellaneous Photographs.

scopecontent.p: Business and Commerce, the first series, contains a number of both interior and exterior images of area businesses, and is divided into eight sub-series: Restaurants, Grocery and Drug Stores, Shoes and Apparel, Automotive Related, Industry, Construction and Demolition, Appliances and Electronics, and Other. Of particular interest are the differing types of period commercial architecture and interior design, as well as the large amount of window and shop advertisement displays featured throughout the various types of retail sub-series.

(interior and exterior photos of multiple store locations)

scopecontent.p: The Youth Activities and Educational Facilities series is made up of a miscellaneous category and three additional sub-series, each depicting a different type of Ann Arbor youth institution. The first sub-series shows images from the Dr. Arnold Kambly Ann Arbor Home and School for Handicapped Children. Included among these images are large numbers of photos of the building's exterior and grounds, as well as interior images of the facilities and photos of the students. The next sub-series is composed entirely of athletic team portraits, primarily boys' football, from Herbert M Slauson Junior High School. Following this is an assortment of group portraiture of various clubs and athletic teams, as well as a selection of snapshots, from The Omega--the Ann Arbor High School Yearbook--taken in the late 1940s and early 1950s.

scopecontent.p: The Community Organizations, Groups and Institutions series contains eight sub-series featuring images showing a wide variety of Ann Arbor and Washtenaw Country groups posing for portraits and attending organization-related activities. The sub-series are broken down based on the specific group, or type of group. They are: American Legion, Kiwanis, Salvation Army, Disabled American Veterans, Boys and Girl Scouts, Zion Evangelical Church Choir, Jim Servis Orchestra, and Fraternal Organizations. This last sub-series is divided into three sub-sub-series, which show several different area Masonic chapters, Shriners, and Elks. The last sub-series is a collection of organizations unrelated to any other category.

did.unittitle: Kiwanis Club, Ann Arbor, Michigan October 9, 1942

did.unittitle: University of Michigan Employees Union, Local 378 January 19, 1957

scopecontent.p: The Miscellaneous Photographs series contains a small sample of the wedding and funeral photographs commissioned over the course of Leach's career. Also included in this series is a small selection of Ann Arbor buildings and locations unrelated to the other series of the collection.

odd.p: (exterior of fire house and Fire Prevention Week displays)
